textContents.story-subtitle: From chance encounters to forever friends â€“ hereâ€™s how our love blossomed.
textContents.story-body: We first crossed paths on a summer adventure and soon realised our lives were meant to intertwine.  Years of laughter, travel and shared dreams brought us closer together.  From lateâ€‘night road trips in a yellow Transit van to climbing real mountains and overcoming figurative ones, our bond has only grown stronger.  We canâ€™t wait to begin the next chapter surrounded by those we love most.
textContents.program-subtitle: Join us for our special day â€“ hereâ€™s how it unfolds
textContents.details-dress: DRESS ATTIRE â€“ NO black dresses or shirts. Our ceremony and reception are held outdoors on lawn, so stilettos arenâ€™t the best option
textContents.details-transport: Parking at Figbird Cottage is limited and taxis are scarce, so please carâ€‘pool where possible. Weâ€™ve arranged a free shuttle bus making multiple trips between 3:30 PM and 4:00 PM from the Nowra Entertainment Centre to Figbird Cottage. There is plenty of parking at the Entertainment Centre. All guests must leave Figbird by 11:00 PM. If youâ€™d like a lift back into town or to a nearby local address, simply tick the lateâ€‘night shuttle option on your RSVP and include your dropâ€‘off street so we can plan routes.
textContents.details-accom: We havenâ€™t reserved accommodation, so please book early â€“ weekends in the Shoalhaven region fill up fast. Great options in Nowra include Quest Nowra (around $220/night), Parkhaven Motel (~$180/night) and Nightcap at Archer (~$190/night). Youâ€™ll also find plenty of charming Airbnbs and holiday cottages in Nowra, Bomaderry and nearby coastal towns like Huskisson, Culburra and Shoalhaven Heads from around $250/night.
